intro: Schizolaena milleri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters and thrives in bright, indirect light. Its foliage is often velvety and comes in various shades of green, while its flowers range from purple to pink. Schizolaena milleri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
